channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9195] Fix TestFSHDFSUtils against java7 test re-ordering
item.description:
The test methods of TestFSHDFSUtils depends on hbase.lease.recovery.dfs.timeout, which is overwritten by testIsFileClosed. In case it runs first, it fails testRecoverLease because it assumes a different value. This makes this test flakey in java7 environment.

The proposed fix is to let both tests specify the property value in their definition.
item.summary: Fix TestFSHDFSUtils against java7 test re-ordering

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Ran TestFSHDFSUtils multiple times and it passes.

against trunk revision .

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

This message is automatically generated.

More details on why or how a lot of isFileClosed calls cause test destabilization? Is does it timeout? is there a race?

TestShell is not on you. Can you check if the findbugs is? (do this before and after the patch, verify the number is the same).


mvn findbugs:findbugs -DskipTests

grep -oh BugInstance hbase-*/target/findbugs.xml | wc -l

Thanks for reviewing Jon.

In internal jenkins, I find it is hanging after the second retry on recoverLease (and doesn't move forward to next iteration on). The only thing it is doing during that time is calling isFileClosed after 10ms. This is what i see in the console:


14:14:58,256 INFO  [Thread-1] util.FSHDFSUtils(173): recoverLease=false, attempt=1 on file=/XXXX/target/test-data/e6526141-23dd-4987-9ec5-578dc2922146/file.txt after 55ms

14:14:59,262 INFO  [Thread-1] util.FSHDFSUtils(173): recoverLease=false, attempt=2 on file=/XXXX/target/test-data/e6526141-23dd-4987-9ec5-578dc2922146/file.txt after 1061ms

It is not that frequent. Let me look at the findbugs report.
findbugs warnings remains same (95 warnings) pre/post patch.

To add more info:
The interesting bit is it fails on java7 build, and has never failed on java6 (yet). This failure is hard to reproduce as I couldn't repro it on any other m/c (tried it on local/other vms on java7). Whenever it fails, it just stops printing after second iteration, and then test just times out (30 sec). The only thing it does b/w 2nd and 3rd try is to keep invoking isFileClosed after every 10ms. This made me think that it is hanging on that call. Upping the pause time is a safety measure just to reduce the number of calls.

So, 10ms wait was a red herring. The root cause was tests were getting re-ordered (java 7), and the property hbase.lease.recovery.dfs.timeout was getting overwritten by testIsFileClosed. Attached is the patch that fixes the issue. I will update the description of the jira.
Was the change in bin/hbase related ?

Do you have a link to the java7 ordering stuff?

This definitely sounds like a much more feasible root cause.
